title: Forever chemicals PFAS won't be in office supplies from 3M - Inhabitat
summary: 3M announced it will stop making forever chemicals starting in 2025, including PFAS, commonly used in household products and coatings. The decision follows increasing regulations and evidence of adverse health effects from these persistent chemicals.
green_innovation: TRUE. This is green innovation as it involves the adoption of alternative manufacturing processes that reduce environmental harm and support sustainability goals.
business_innovation: TRUE. This is a business innovation as it involves 3M making a significant change to its product line, moving away from manufacturing forever chemicals like PFAS.
green_product: TRUE. The article discusses the move by 3M to discontinue the production of PFAS, which are harmful chemicals commonly found in various household items, showcasing a shift towards environmentally friendly practices.
green_process: TRUE. The article highlights 3M's decision to cease manufacturing PFAS chemicals, a crucial step towards reducing environmental impacts and promoting sustainable practices in production processes.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 325211 - Plastics material and resin manufacturing, 325998 - All other miscellaneous chemical product and preparation manufacturing, 325188 - All other basic inorganic chemical manufacturing, 334517 - Irradiation apparatus manufacturing
greenwashing: FALSE. This is not an example of greenwashing as 3M's decision to discontinue PFAS production aligns with environmental sustainability goals and regulatory trends, rather than misleading or falsely promoting environmental benefits.
